rComments: Such an amazing and engaging professor! You can really tell that he works hard to make his lectures informational, thought provoking, and interesting. The class was a half seminar and half lecture type of course, and gave students the option to do a discussion or write a final paper for their final. I recommend taking this if you like discussions!

By far my favourite professor at the university so far. He is a fantastic lecturer, is caring, and does what he can to make student's lives easier. I will 100% be taking any other courses that he teaches. Although it is optional, I also really enjoyed and learned a lot from the CSL portion of the class.

Dr. Hammond's Child Development course is organized, lectures are interesting, and he is helpful outside of class. He seems to care about helping his students in various areas of academia. Weekly blogs help. Exams can be tricky because sometimes answers vary from what is on what is covered in class with varying levels of interpretation. Good prof!

Hammond is a super nice guy and he teaches pretty well, but his evaluations are super tricky - be prepared, the questions have multiple right answers listed and it's a bit of a shot in the dark to pick the right one. Assignment was easy but marked hard, and the blogs are a good grade booster. Take for an A that you'll have to work for a bit...
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Tough grader', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: I took this class bc its easy and overall Im getting a good grade. Dr. Hammond is a nice prof, however, his exams are so rediculously ambiguous and tricky. He barely taught any content the entire term (hence easy) so compensates for it i guess with the test. He will reference obscure examples he talked about in class on the exam. Slides unhelpful.

Go to class and pay attention and the exams shouldn't be an issue. 1 midterm, 1 paper, weekly blogs and a final. Great course overall. Prof Hammond is really approachable which made me more comfortable as a 1st year in a 2nd year class. Prepares you for future academics. Its super cool to learn from someone who specializes in that field. 10/10

Dr Hammond is awesome! If you show up and listen you should be able to get a good grade no problem. He's a super nice guy and makes the material engaging and fun. He also taught valuable stuff about how to research properly. TAKE HIS CLASS if you are in psychology (or any soc. sci.) or if child development sounds even remotely interesting to you!

He gave good lectures but it was often repetitive. He gave good hints for the midterms and the final. I barely used the textbook but I attended most of the classes and still got a good grade. Most of the content in the lectures is super interesting and he uses videos and examples which I really liked. Overall he's great!

Gave a VERY in depth review of the midterms and exam material beforehand (to the point where you basically knew every question before seeing the test). Go to enough of the classes to not be completely lost and then read up in the textbook and answer the questions in that exam content guide using the textbook and you'll get an A+
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Participation matters', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Very caring prof that is passionate for his material. Interesting class discussions. I enjoyed the class but found his exam questions to be very difficult and weirdly worded. The assignment + participation made the class an easy A.

Hammond is an exceptional professor with a genuine love for his field of study, which shows in his lectures. He provides tips for extra curricular things that will help students in the future, and gives extremely detailed exam review which is mirrored on his exams. Amazing prof- do what you can to get in his class

Stuart is a great prof! His lectures are more discussion based than content based and it makes the classes interesting. Attendance is worth a part of your grade and the other assignments aren't hard! It's an interesting class and pretty easy to do well

I loved Prof. Hammond. His class is very relaxed and really encourages discussion and real-life applications of the subject matter. Weekly blog posts and attendance was worth 20% of the grade, along with a paper, take home or oral final exam, a group blog post (easiest group project ever). I learned a lot and he is a very kind prof.

Stuart Hammond is a great prof. He is extremely interesting and promotes discussion in class. The only thing I would say is that his class is too easy that it doesn't make me want to go to class, but you also can only miss a certain amount because he takes attendance.

I loved Stuart. He is such a nice prof, really cares for his students and doesnt want to stress them out. No tests or exams in PSY 3135 only three papers which are relatively easy. Also no final exam, take home paper or gives the option of doing an oral exam which a lot of people prefer.

Had a great experience with professor Hammond. He was incredibly accessible in his office hours and was ready to not just answer your questions, but have discussions about topics. Would definitely take a class with him again! Very helpful and definitely knows his stuff.

This prof is a gem. He genuinely cares a lot about his students, and he's willing to go out of his way to make accommodations to ensure you can do well. He focuses a lot of his testing on what can prepare you for grad school, which obviously is important for most psych students. He's also very knowledgeable about his field.

This class is very is and little material differs from the intro psych classes. Prof Hammond lectures are a little hard to follow as he tend to talk about think in random orders and always circles around the point. Half the class is always review which is really unnecessary and gets really repetitve

Good prof, lectures are sometimes hard to follow, but if you take good notes in class from what he says, you are golden. Slides posted are very minimal, and midterms is mostly based on class material, there attendance is recommended!

Dr. Hammond is a nice guy, kind of scatter brained at times, but he's a very smart guy.  Only 1 midterm, and both the midterm and final were only MC questions.. So if you are good at that then you'll do great. Definitely go to class as he talks more in class than what is on the slides. Lots of in class examples are on tests so go to class!

1 short assignment, midterm, final + weekly blogs (free 10%). He gives exam questions in advance but you really have to pay attention in lectures because the multiple choice answers are TRICKY! Most info is from lectures and slides, textbook can probably be shared with other students, not 100% necessary. Overall, easy course, prof is super nice!

I was a little disappointed going into this class. Prof. Hammond has raving reviews on this site but I just found him to be an average professor. He is kind and delivers the material effectively, his lectures aren't too engaging, though. Also your entire grade is based on group work. If that's your thing, great, if not, good luck.

One of the best Psych courses in my entire undergrad. There were no tests, but we had to maintain a personal blog. There is also a group blog  poster presentation and two papers. There is a lot of writing in this course but the content is great so I had fun. He really wants you to get the most out of it! Super laid back. All readings online.

Loved this guy, welcome to uOttawa Stu! Great lectures and he is very passionate about the material. His tests are tricky, he definitely knows how to write multiple choice where 3 out of 4 answers seem correct. For every midterm and exam, he actually provides the questions ahead of time (just not the multiple choice options), so you can't complain.
